biography: "Seth Bernard has a uniquely Michigan anatomy: knee deep in glacier-folk with a belly full of whiskey and peaches smuggled from the root cellar of a '70s guitar god. Fingers resinous with fresh cut white pine, and sacred north star geometries whirling around his brow.Born on April Fools Day, and playing the trickster-bard every day since, he's grown from a potent young Interlochen idealist into a black-bearded surprise-eyed psych-rocker singing the woods and water, souls and soils of the Great Lakes.The tools! He's got a pine-box-full, from his Gretsch (and the chops to play it, mister), to the many iterations of Seth-music. From Airborne or Aquatic, bristling with fuzz-poem arena-anthems, to the autumnal instrumental soundscapes of Ecotone. Or he can roll solo, with a catalog of hundreds of original tunes, thousands of covers and millions of improvisational licks. And the waltzes. By god the waltzes.And more tools: Earthwork Music, Earthwork Harvest Gathering, Title Track, The Clean Water Campaign, (you gotta google this stuff), youth engagement, and partnerships with dozens of local non-profits. Like a true old-school folkie, he plays the songs because they mean something, and that something they mean drives a life beyond just playing songs.His most valuable tool, though, doesn't live in that box: two good ears. Seth listens like a priest. To his audience, to his community, to his deep-rooted intuitive star-born aurora borealis campfire ancestor soul. That alone makes every show - EVERY SHOW - worth the price of admission."-Brad Kik, co-founder of Crosshatch Center for Art and Ecology
name: Earthwork Music

biography: co-founder of LUUMI, backpacker & activist.I first started working replacing single use plastic with multi use silicone about 10 years ago.Founded SiliSolutions in 2013, which became luumi in 2016.I've spent my life travelling, mostly with a backpack, and have fallen in love with the cultures and nature I have seen, but I also witnessed the impact of our unconscious single use plastics habit all over the world.I wanted to do what I could to make the world a little stronger than how I found it, and I focused on my own habits to look for a way, and that lead to a mountain of plastic I was shedding daily.I'd had some experience with platinum silicone in the film industry and realized it was a viable solution.

biography: I am an award-winning designer and inventor with 5 successful projects launched on Kickstarter over the past three years.My goal is to create functionally and aesthetically simple products and devices that can become eco-friendly substitutes for the ones we use today. Taking the simplicity of nature, I design these objects so that they require few resources and little energy to create. Optimizing the use of resources ensures minimal waste and makes future recycling easier.This approach to design goes a long way toward saving the natural resources currently being depleted by industry. These are objects of the future, and I hope that more and more people join me on the path to creating a sustainable, eco-friendly planet by using them and giving feedback.

biography: Andrea Sfiligoi is an Italian game designer and illustrator living in Ukraine. He writes, illustrates and publishes games on www.ganeshagames.net. His books have been published in English, Italian, French, Spanish and German. He has also written for Osprey Publishing (Of Gods and Mortals, A Fistful of kung Fu, Rogue Stars). His most successful line is the Four Against Darkness series, a best-selling solo rpg/adventure game.His other well-known titles are wargames like the Origins-nominated "Song of Blades and Heroes". He also wrote Fear and Faith, Mutants and Death Ray Guns, Mighty Monsters,  and many others. His gaming system has also been adapted by other authors, including Sergio Laliscia who won an Origins award with Song of Drums and Shakos.
